result.execSummary:
The defendant Joann S Bickle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to comply with DNA sample provision

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joann S Bickle

defendant.name: Bickle, Joann S
defendant.address: 205 E. Hilltop Tr, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:31 am [sf]
Defendant Joann S Bickle in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Probation Agent Jesse Phelps appears via telephone.

Court reviews that hearing was set on DOC's Petition to Discharge Probation Early.
ADA Shock advises that he cannot tell from his file if contact was made with the victim regarding this hearing. ADA Shock requests a few minutes to speak with the victim witness coordinator to verify if contact was made.
Court allows ADA Shock time to speak with the victim witness coordinator.

ADA Shock advises that there is victim rights compliance and that the State takes no position on the Petition.
Ms. Bickle makes a statement to the court.
Ms. Ottow makes a statement on behalf of the victims family.

Court presents basis and grants the Petition for Early Discharge terminated effective today. Amended JOC to be prepared and to reflect the date of termination is today.

recess: 10:47 am
Probation review hearing on May 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Probation review hearing on May 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 1:33pm. 
Defendant Joann S Bickle in court with Attorney Andrew Walter.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (victim impact statements submitted); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Ms. Bickle guilty of the three counts, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Statement given by victim Jill Ottow.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Ms. Bickle makes a statement.


On Counts #1, #2, and #3 each, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for three years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessments, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with Dorothy Ottow or any other member of the Ottow family
--Ms. Bickle is not to be employed or volunteer in any position where Ms. Bickle be responsible for the care of any "individual at risk" as that term is defined in Statute 943.20(2)(ae)
--testing for illegal drug use; testing is to occur at least once per month
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge on Count #1 
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge on Count #2
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge on Count #3

The Court sets the restitution amount at $0
Days credit for time already served:  0 days
Felony firearm prohibition warnings given
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties given
recess 2:00pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:03 am
Defendant Joann S Bickle in court with Attorney Andrew Walter. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Walter informs the Court that the defense was proceed to plea and sentencing but that the victim has reqwuested to be present at sentencing.
ADA Hall informs the Court that the victim has requested to appear at the plea and sentencing but htat they are not available until after 6/19/14.
Court indicates that hearing should be set after 6/19/14 at least 10 days to give notice.
Attonrey Walter informs the Court that he is not available June 30 - July 10th

recess: 9:04 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Plea and Sentencing: to be set (30 minutes)
Status conference on June 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 9:35 am 
Defendant Joann S Bickle in court with Attorney Andrew Walter. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Bickle waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Speedy trial not demanded by Defense Counsel
ADA Shock informs the Court that a pre-trial conference is not needed, as one has already been conducted
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Ms. Bickle
Recess: 9:38 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC in approximately 30 days - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.

case called at 1:13pm.
Defendant Joann S Bickle in court with Attorney Andrew Walter.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The date of birth and address on the Complaint are verified as being accurate 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court amends the Criminal Complaint, by its own hand, to correct the spelling of the last name:  Ottow
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $750   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no direct or indirect contact contact will Jill Ottow, Dorothy Ottow, or John Ottow
--no presence at N2447 Kunz Road in the Town of Sumner
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

The Court informs the parties that it knows Jill Ottow and was on a committee with Ms. Ottow.  The Court does not feel the need to recuse. 
recess  1:17pm. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference to be scheduled by counsel informally  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing in approximately 30-45 days
